entry.title: Sheriff Expresses Concern Over 32-Hour Work Week for Law Enforcement
entry.summary: July 19, 2024 I would like to take this opportunity to express my concerns on the concept of a 32-hour work week.Â This is an act introduced by U.S. Senator Bernie Sanders (Vermont) that would amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to reduce the standard workweek from 40 hours per week to 32 hours per week.Â AÂ version of that act was recently adopted (June 10, 2024) by the City of Roseburg in conjunction with the 3-year union contract for the Roseburg Police Department.Â The Roseburg City contractÂ would standardize a 32-hour workweek with no loss in pay. Â For example, an officer working 32 hours in a week but getting paid for 40 hours would equate to a 20% increase in pay for that week, and it falls on the backs of the taxpayer. Â This would also make Roseburg Police Officers among the hâ€¦

entry.title: Level 2 "Be Set" evacuation issued for homes in Slide Creek area

entry.title: Level 2 BE SET Evacuation Notice Issued Due to Boulder Flat Fire
entry.summary: TOKETEE, Ore. - A Level 2 BE SET evacuation notice has been issued for all homes in the Slide Creek area downstream to the Soda Springs area. This in inclusive of all addresses between these two points.Â A Level 2 - BE SET EVACUATION NOTICE means YOU MUST PREPARE TO LEAVE AT A MOMENTS NOTICE. This level indicates there is significant danger to your area, and you should either voluntarily relocate to a shelter or with family/friends outside of the affected area, or if choosing to remain, to be ready to evacuate at a moment's notice. You MAY have time to gather necessary items, but doing so is at your own risk. THIS MAY BE THE ONLY NOTICE YOU RECEIVE. Emergency services cannot guarantee that they will be able to notify you if conditions rapidly deteriorate.Â The implementation of this Level 2 BE SET notice is a result of the Boulder Flat Fire burning on the Umpqua National Forest near the Soda Springs/Pine Bench area.Â An interactive evacuation map can be found at https://www.dcso.com/evacuations.

entry.title: ODF Northeast Oregon District responds to multiple fire starts after lightning storm; ODF IMT 3 deployed to Battle Mountain Complex
entry.summary: La Grande, ORâ€”The Oregon Department of Forestryâ€™s (ODF) Northeast District has responded to 17 fires in the last 24 hours as a result of the recent lightning event that moved across Oregon. Three large fires of note are the Durkee Fire, the Snake Fire and the NF Owen Fire, all of which started in the late afternoon and evening of July 17, 2024.Â The district has combined the NF Owen Fire (approx. 400 ac.) and the Snake Fire (approx. 1,000 ac.) to create the Battle Mountain Complex near Ukiah, Oregon. ODFâ€™s Incident Management Team 3 has been deployed to the Battle Mountain Complex and will be inbriefed this afternoon. The team will take unified command of the complex with the Oregon State Fire Marshalâ€™s Green Team at 0900 on Friday, July 19, 2024. They will be working in close partnership â€¦

entry.title: Draft wildfire hazard maps posted for public comment
entry.summary:
SALEM, Ore.Â â€” Draft versions of the statewide wildfire hazard and wildland-urban interface maps are available to the public for review and comment starting today on Oregon State Universityâ€™sÂ Wildfire Risk Explorer website.Â The wildfire hazard map's purposes are to:
Educate Oregon residents and property owners about the level of hazard where they live. Assist in prioritizing fire adaptation and mitigation resources for the most vulnerable locations. Identify where defensible space standards and home hardening codes will apply.
A series of open houses about the stateâ€™s new community wildfire risk reduction programs were held from June 3 to July 1 throughout Oregon. It was an opportunity to learn about wildfire hazard assessments, new defensible space and home hardening programs and standaâ€¦
